radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases, heart, and pericardium are unremarkable. The liver enhances homogeneously with no focal liver lesions. No intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation. The portal vein is patent. The gallbladder is normal. The spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable. A subcentimeter hypodensity in the upper pole of the left kidney that is too small to characterize. No hydronephrosis in either kidney. The kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. The stomach and small bowel are unremarkable. The colon is normal. The appendix is enlarged with hyperemic walls and possible fat stranding surrounding it. No evidence of abscess or extraluminal air. The rectum is unremarkable. The bladder and terminal ureters are normal. The prostate and seminal vesicles are normal. No pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy. No hernias identified. The intra-abdominal vasculature is patent. No acute bony abnormality.
